1906

January 26, 1912.

Mr. S. C. Luk,

Angola, Indi ana.

My dear Luki

Your letter of the 230 inst. has reached me and I am glad to learn

that you have recently received funds from home,

I have looked over your

accounts es requested to find just what the situation is,

On November 14th I handed you a statement of your account to that

time showing a deficit of 9234.92.

This deficit did not include e Loan of

$250, which I had secured from the Trustees in your favor, consequently to 
the $234.92 referred to should be added $250., plus interest amounting to

1,88.

on November 29th I sent you at your request a check for $10è., and

on Deceraber 18th I paid a bill of Dennis Triplett for a suit and overcoat

aounting to $4.50.

As I figure it this brings the total of your indebt -
edness to 1535.30.

Apparently this will leave you very littia from the

draft referred to with which to meet your regular expenses at college.

I

would suggest, therefore, that if it is going to embarrass you to meet the

whole amount at this time, you may send part of it and I will carry the

balance on your account until some later date when you will find it possi -
ble to clear it up without serious inconvenience.

kasuring you of yay continued interest in all that pertains to

your welfare, believe me, with cordial personal regards,

feithfully yours,
